intro: Dieffenbachia seguine f. decora, commonly known as the Decorum Dieffenbachia, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, lance-shaped leaves that are typically bright green with white or cream-colored veins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers, though it is more appreciated for its foliage than its blooms. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture and humidity. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
